headline: Both deliver excellent experiences with different atmospheres
summary: Permanent lodges offer more conventional hotel-like comfort with solid walls and consistent amenities. Tented camps offer immersive bush atmosphere while still providing excellent comfort (proper beds, en-suite bathrooms). Luxury tented camps are not camping. The choice is about atmosphere preference, not comfort level.

assumptions.text: Quality tented camps have proper beds, en-suite bathrooms, and excellent service.
Tented camps feel more connected to the bush; lodges feel more hotel-like.
Cost depends more on location and exclusivity than tent vs. lodge structure.

gains: Lodge: Often better for families with children
Tented: Sounds of wildlife at night
losses: Tented: Canvas walls (psychological, not practical concern)
Tented: May feel less secure for some travelers

change_conditions: If bush atmosphere is priority, quality tented camps deliver uniquely.
If conventional hotel comfort is important, lodges may feel more familiar.
If traveling with young children, some may prefer solid-walled lodges.
If wildlife sounds at night appeal, tented camps provide this experience.
